page.title: 18THE ANTHONY CURTON VA SCHOOL
page.content: In 1723 a farmer called ANTHONY CURTON endowed money for the provsion of a school in Walpole.A schoolroom was established above the south porch at Walpole St. Peter church.On payment any child from Walpole could attend this school.In 1806 new premises were built for the school opposite the rectory.Following an extension in 1923 this school survived until 1983 and at that time was the oldest entire working school in Norfolk. After the 1870 Education Act and the opening of a school at Walpole St. Andrew,the Curtons Endowed School was used mainly for boys aged 7-14.The opening of our new school gave the Walpoles not just classrooms but also a hall,kitchen,library,offices and playing field.
